ALICE.longDescription: You are in a small square room, in the center of which is a large oblong table, no doubt set for afternoon tea. It is clear from the objects on the table that the users were indeed mad. In the eastern corner of the room is a small hole (no more that four inches high). There are passageways leading away to the west and the northwest.

exits.message: Only a mouse could get in there.

ALISM.longDescription: You are in an enormous room, in the center of which are four wooden posts delineating a rectanular area, above which is what appears to be a wooden roof. In fact, all objects in this room appear to be abnormally large. To the east is a passageway. There is a large chasm on the west and the northwest.

exits.message: There is a chasm too large to jump across.
There is a chasm too large to jump across.
There is a chasm too large to jump across.

ALITR.longDescription: You are in a large room, one half of which is depressed. There is a large leak in the ceiling through which brown colored goop is falling. The only exit to this room is to the west.

ATLAN.longDescription: You are in an ancient room, long buried by the Reservoir.  There are exits here to the southeast and upward.

ATTIC.longDescription: You are in the attic. The only exit is stairs that lead down.

BARRE.longDescription: You are in a barrel. Congratulations. Etched into the side of the barrel is the word 'Geronimo!'.

BATS.longDescription: You are in a small room that smells of bat droppings. A passage leads to the east.

BEACH.longDescription: You are on a large sandy beach at the shore of the river, which is flowing quickly by. A path runs beside the river to the south here.

BLADD.longDescription: You are in a rather wide room. On one side is the bottom of a narrow wooden ladder. To the northeast and the south are passages leaving the room.

BLROO.longDescription: You are in a long passage. To the south is one entrance. On the east there is an old wooden door, with a large hole in it (about cyclops sized).

BOOM.longDescription: You are in a small room which smells strongly of coal gas.

BSHAF.longDescription: You are in a small square room which is at the bottom of a long shaft. To the east is a passageway and to the northeast a very narrow passage. In the shaft can be seen a heavy iron chain.

exits.message: You cannot fit through this passage with that load.
You cannot fit through this passage with that load.
Not a chance.
The chain is not climbable.

BWELL.longDescription: You are in a damp circular room, whose walls are made of brick and mortar. The roof of this room is not visible, but there appear to be some etchings on the walls. There is a passageway to the west.

exits.message: The walls cannot be climbed.

CAGED.longDescription: You are trapped inside an iron cage.

CAGER.longDescription:
You are in a dingy closet adjacent to the machine room. On one wall is a small sticker which says
		Protected by
		  FROBOZZ
	     Magic Alarm Company
	      (Hello, footpad!)

CANY1.longDescription: You are on the south edge of a deep canyon. Passages lead off to the east, south, and northwest. You can hear the sound of flowing water below.

CAROU.longDescription: You are in a large, circular room with smooth, featureless walls. The room is rotating slowly.

CAVE1.longDescription: You are in a small cave with an entrance to the north and a stairway leading down.

CAVE2.longDescription: You are in a tiny cave with entrances west and north, and a dark, forbidding staircase leading down.

CAVE3.longDescription: You are in a cave.  Passages exit to the south and to the east, but the cave narrows to a crack to the west.  The earth is particularly damp here.

exits.message: It is too narrow for most insects.

CAVE4.longDescription: You have entered a cave with passages leading north and southeast.

CELLA.longDescription: You are in the cellar. A passage leads to the east, another to the south. A steep, slippery ramp descends to the west. The trap door is above you.

exits.message: The trap door has been barred from the other side.
You try to ascend the ramp, but it is impossible, and you slide back down.

CHAS1.longDescription: A chasm runs southwest to northeast. You are on the south edge; the path exits to the south and to the east.

exits.message: Are you out of your mind?

CHAS2.longDescription: You are on the west edge of a chasm, the bottom of which cannot be seen. The east side is sheer rock, providing no exits. A narrow passage goes west, and the path you are on continues to the north and south.

exits.message: The chasm probably leads straight to the infernal regions.

CHAS3.longDescription: A chasm, evidently produced by an ancient river, runs through the cave here.  Passages lead off in all directions.

CLBOT.longDescription: You are beneath the walls of the river canyon which may be climbable here. There is a small stream here, which is the lesser part of the runoff of Aragain Falls. To the north is a narrow path.

CLEAR.longDescription: You are in a clearing, with a forest surrounding you on all sides. A path leads south.

CLMID.longDescription: You are on a ledge about halfway up the wall of the river canyon. You can see from here that the main flow from Aragain Falls twists along a passage which it is impossible to enter. Below you is the canyon bottom. Above you is more cliff, which still appears climbable.

CLTOP.longDescription: You are at the top of the Great Canyon on its south wall. From here there is a marvelous view of the Canyon and parts of the Frigid River upstream. Across the canyon, the walls of the White Cliffs still appear to loom far above. Following the Canyon upstream (north and northwest), Aragain Falls may be seen, complete with rainbow. Fortunately, my vision is better than average and I can discern the top of the Flood Control Dam #3 far to the distant north. To the west and south can be seen an immense forest, stretching for miles around. It is possible to climb down into the canyon from here.

CMACH.longDescription: You are in a room with a square button, a round button, and a triangular button.

CRAW1.longDescription: You are in a crawlway with a three-foot high ceiling. Your footing is very unsure here due to the assortment of rocks underfoot. Passages can be seen in the east, west, and northwest corners of the passage.

CRAW2.longDescription: You are in a steep and narrow crawlway. There are two exits nearby to the south and southwest.

CRAW3.longDescription: You are in a narrow crawlway. The crawlway leads from north to south. However the south passage divides to the south and southwest.

CRAW4.longDescription: You are in a north-south crawlway; a passage goes to the east also. There is a hole above, but it provides no opportunities for climbing.

CYCLO.longDescription: You are in a large room, obviously the chamber of the cyclops, who is sleeping on the floor. There is a staircase leading up.

exits.message: The north wall is solid rock.
The cyclops doesn't look like he'll let you past.

DAM.longDescription: You are standing on the top of the Frotz Dam, which was constructed in 1934. The dam is made of reinforced concrete, and is quite impressive. The spillway is to the north. The reservoir is to the south.

exits.message: You can't go that way. The reservoir is deep and fast-moving.

DEAD2.longDescription: You are in a dead end.

DOCK.longDescription: You are at the base of Flood Control Dam #3, which looms above you and to the north. The river Frigid is flowing by here. Across the river are the White Cliffs which seem to form a giant wall stretching from north to south along the east shore of the river as it winds its way downstream.

DOME.longDescription: You are in a large dome-shaped room.

exits.message: You cannot go down without fracturing many bones.
You cannot go down without fracturing many bones.

ECHO.longDescription: You are in a large room with a ceiling which cannot be detected from the ground. There is a narrow passage from east to west and a stone stairway leading upward.  The room is extremely noisy.  In fact, it is difficult to hear yourself think.

EGYPT.longDescription: You are in a room which looks like an Egyptian tomb. There is an ascending staircase in the room as well as doors, east and south.

exits.message: The passage is too narrow to accomodate coffins.

EHOUS.longDescription: You are behind the white house. A path leads into the forest to the east. In one corner of the house there is a small window which is slightly ajar.

ENTRA.longDescription: You are standing at the entrance of what might have been a coal mine. To the northeast and the northwest are entrances to the mine, and there is another exit on the south end of the room.

FALLS.longDescription: You are at the top of Aragain Falls, an enormous waterfall with a drop of about 450 feet. The only path here is on the north end.

FANTE.longDescription: You are on the shore of the River. The river here seems somewhat treacherous. A path travels from north to south here, the south end quickly turning around a sharp corner.

FCHMP.longDescription: You have gone over the falls and are now a soggy memory.

FORE1.longDescription: You are in a forest, with trees in all directions around you.

FORE2.longDescription: You are in a dimly lit forest, with large trees all around. To the east, there appears to be sunlight.

FORE3.longDescription: You are in a dimly lit forest, with large trees all around. To the east, there appears to be sunlight.

FORE4.longDescription: You are in a large forest, with trees obstructing all views except to the east, where a small clearing may be seen through the trees.

FORE5.longDescription: You are in a forest, with trees in all directions around you.

GALLE.longDescription: You are in an art gallery. Most of the paintings which were here have been stolen by vandals with exceptional taste. The vandals left through either the north or south exits.

ICY.longDescription: This is a large room, which is totally empty. It is also rather cold.

KITCH.longDescription: You are in the kitchen of the white house. A table seems to have been used recently for the preparation of food. A passage leads to the west and a dark staircase can be seen leading upward. A dark chimney leads down and to the east is a small window which is open.

exits.message: Only Santa Claus climbs down chimneys.

LAVA.longDescription: You are in a small room, whose walls are formed by an old lava flow. There are exits here to the west and the south.

LEDG2.longDescription: You are on a narrow ledge overlooking the inside of an old dormant volcano. This ledge appears to be about in the middle between the floor below and the rim above. There is an exit here to the south.

exits.message: I wouldn't jump from here.

LEDG3.longDescription: You are on a ledge in the middle of a large volcano.  Below you the volcano bottom can be seen and above is the rim of the volcano. A couple of ledges can be seen on the other side of the volcano; it appears that this ledge is intermediate in elevation between those on the other side.  The exit from this room is to the east.

exits.message: I wouldn't try that.
It is impossible to cross this distance.

LEDG4.longDescription: You are on a wide ledge high into the volcano. The rim of the volcano is about 200 feet above and there is a precipitous drop below to the bottom. There is a small door to the south.

exits.message: It's a long way down.

LIBRA.longDescription: You are in a room which must have been a large library, probably for the royal family. All of the shelves appear to have been gnawed to pieces by unfriendly gnomes. To the north is an exit.

LLD1.longDescription: You are at the entrance to the Land of the Living Dead. A gate, decorated with strange carvings, is here. The gate is open. A dark passage leads to the east.

exits.message: Some invisible force prevents you from passing through the gate.
Some invisible force prevents you from passing through the gate.

LLD2.longDescription: You are in the Land of the Living Dead, a large desolate room. Although it is apparently uninhabited, you can hear the sounds of thousands of lost souls weeping and moaning.

LOBBY.longDescription: This room appears to have been the waiting room for groups touring the dam. There are exits here to the north and east marked 'Private', though the doors are open, and an exit to the south.

LROOM.longDescription: You are in the living room. There is a doorway to the east, a wooden door with strange gothic lettering to the west, which appears to be nailed shut, a trophy case, and a large oriental rug in the center of the room.

exits.message: The door is nailed shut.

MACHI.longDescription: You are in a large room which seems to be air-conditioned. In one corner there is a machine (?) which is shaped somewhat like a clothes dryer. On the 'panel' there is a switch which is labelled in a dialect of Swahili. Fortunately, I know this dialect and the label translates to START. The switch does not appear to be manipulable by any human hand (unless the fingers are about 1/16 by 1/4 inch). On the front of the machine is a large lid.

MAGNE.longDescription: You are in a low room with exits in all directions. A robot is here.

MAINT.longDescription: You are in what appears to have been the maintenance room for Flood Control Dam #3, judging by the assortment of tool chests around the room. Apparently, this room has been ransacked recently, for most of the valuable equipment is gone. On the wall in front of you is a panel of buttons, which are labelled in EBCDIC. However, they are of different colors: Blue, Yellow, Brown, and Red. The doors to this room are in the west and south ends.

MAZ10.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZ11.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZ12.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZ13.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZ14.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZ15.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE1.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE2.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE3.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE4.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE5.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE6.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE7.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE8.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MAZE9.longDescription: You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike.

MGRAI.longDescription: You are standing in a small circular room with a pedestal. A set of stairs leads up, and passages leave to the east and west.

MGRAT.longDescription: You are in a small room with a grating on the floor. The grating is locked.

exits.message: The grating is locked

MINE1.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE2.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE3.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE4.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE5.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE6.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MINE7.longDescription: You are in a non-descript part of a coal mine.

MIRR1.longDescription: You are in a large room containing a mirror.

MIRR2.longDescription: You are in a large room containing a mirror.

MPEAR.longDescription: This is a former broom closet. The exits are to the east and west.

MTORC.longDescription: You are in a small room with a pedestal. A wooden door leads to the west.

exits.message: You cannot reach the rope.

MTROL.longDescription: You are in a small room with passages off in all directions. Bloodstains and deep scratches (perhaps made by an axe) mar the walls.

exits.message: The troll fends you off with a menacing gesture.
The troll fends you off with a menacing gesture.
The troll fends you off with a menacing gesture.

NHOUS.longDescription: You are facing the north side of a white house. There is no door here, and all the windows are barred.

exits.message: The windows are all barred.

PASS1.longDescription: You are in a narrow east-west passageway. There is a narrow stairway leading down at the north end of the room.

PASS3.longDescription: You are in a cold and damp corridor where a long east-west passageway intersects with a northward path.

PASS4.longDescription: You are in a winding passage. It seems that there is only an exit on the east end although the whirring from the round room can be heard faintly to the north.

exits.message: You hear the whir of the carousel room but can find no entrance.

PASS5.longDescription: You are in a high north-south passage, which forks to the northeast.

POG.longDescription: You are on a small beach on the continuation of the Frigid River past the Falls. The beach is narrow due to the presence of the White Cliffs. The river canyon opens here and sunlight shines in from above. A rainbow crosses over the falls to the west and a narrow path continues to the southeast.

RAINB.longDescription: You are on top of a rainbow (I bet you never thought you would walk on a rainbow), with a magnificent view of the Falls. The rainbow travels east-west here. There is an NBC Commissary here.

RAVI1.longDescription: You are in a deep ravine at a crossing with an east-west crawlway. Some stone steps are at the south of the ravine and a steep staircase descends.

RCAVE.longDescription: You are on the west shore of the river. An entrance to a cave is to the northwest. The shore is very rocky here.

RESEN.longDescription: You are at the north end of a large reservoir.

exits.message: You are not equipped for swimming.
You are not equipped for swimming.

RESES.longDescription: You are on the southern shore of a large reservoir.

exits.message: The coffin will not fit through this passage.
You are not equipped for swimming.
You are not equipped for swimming.
The stairs are too steep for carrying the coffin.

RIDDL.longDescription:
This is a room which is bare on all sides. There is an exit down. To the east is a great door made of stone. Above the stone, the following words are written: 'No man shall enter this room without solving this riddle:
  What is tall as a house,
	  round as a cup, 
	  and all the king's horses can't draw it up?'

exits.message: Your way is blocked by an invisible force.

RIVR1.longDescription: You are on the River Frigid in the vicinity of the Dam. The river flows quietly here. There is a landing on the west shore.

exits.message: You cannot go upstream due to strong currents.
The White Cliffs prevent your landing here.

RIVR2.longDescription: The River turns a corner here making it impossible to see the Dam. The White Cliffs loom on the east bank and large rocks prevent landing on the west.

exits.message: You cannot go upstream due to strong currents.
The White Cliffs prevent your landing here.

RIVR3.longDescription: The river descends here into a valley. There is a narrow beach on the east below the cliffs and there is some shore on the west which may be suitable. In the distance a faint rumbling can be heard.

exits.message: You cannot go upstream due to strong currents.
You must specify which direction here.

RIVR4.longDescription: The river is running faster here and the sound ahead appears to be that of rushing water. On the west shore is a sandy beach. A small area of beach can also be seen below the Cliffs.

exits.message: You cannot go upstream due to strong currents.
You must specify which direction to land.

RIVR5.longDescription: The sound of rushing water is nearly unbearable here. On the west shore is a large landing area.

exits.message: You cannot go upstream due to strong currents.

RUBYR.longDescription: You are in a small chamber behind the remains of the Great Glacier. To the south and west are small passageways.

SAFE.longDescription: You are in a dusty old room which is virtually featureless, except for an exit on the north side.

SHOUS.longDescription: You are facing the south side of a white house. There is no door here, and all the windows are barred.

exits.message: The windows are all barred.

SLIDE.longDescription: You are in a small chamber, which appears to have been part of a coal mine. On the south wall of the chamber the letters "Granite Wall" are etched in the rock. To the east is a long passage and there is a steep metal slide twisting downward. From the appearance of the slide, an attempt to climb up it would be impossible. To the north is a small opening.

SMELL.longDescription: You are in a small non-descript room. However, from the direction of a small descending staircase a foul odor can be detected. To the east is a narrow path.

SQUEE.longDescription: You are a small room. Strange squeaky sounds may be heard coming from the passage at the west end. You may also escape to the south.

STREA.longDescription: You are standing on a path beside a flowing stream. The path travels to the north and the east.

STUDI.longDescription: You are in what appears to have been an artist's studio. The walls and floors are splattered with paints of 69 different colors. Strangely enough, nothing of value is hanging here. At the north and northwest of the room are open doors (also covered with paint). An extremely dark and narrow chimney leads up from a fireplace; although you might be able to get up it, it seems unlikely you could get back down.

exits.message: The chimney is too narrow for you and all of your baggage.

TCAVE.longDescription: You are in a small cave whose exits are on the south and northwest.

TEMP1.longDescription: You are in the west end of a large temple. On the south wall is an ancient inscription, probably a prayer in a long-forgotten language. The north wall is solid granite. The entrance at the west end of the room is through huge marble pillars.

TEMP2.longDescription: You are in the east end of a large temple. In front of you is what appears to be an altar.

TIMBE.longDescription: You are in a long and narrow passage, which is cluttered with broken timbers. A wide passage comes from the north and turns at the southwest corner of the room into a very narrow passageway.

exits.message: You cannot fit through this passage with that load.

TLADD.longDescription: You are in a very small room. In the corner is a rickety wooden ladder, leading downward. It might be safe to descend. There is also a staircase leading upward.

TOMB.longDescription:
You are in the Tomb of the Unknown Implementer.
A hollow voice says:  "That's not a bug, it's a feature!"

TREAS.longDescription: This is a large room, whose north wall is solid granite. A number of discarded bags, which crumble at your touch, are scattered about on the floor.

TSHAF.longDescription: You are in a large room, in the middle of which is a small shaft descending through the floor into darkness below. To the west and the north are exits from this room. Constructed over the top of the shaft is a metal framework to which a heavy iron chain is attached.

exits.message: You wouldn't fit and would die if you could.

TUNNE.longDescription: You are in a narrow tunnel with large wooden beams running across the ceiling and around the walls. A path from the south splits into paths running west and northeast.

TWELL.longDescription: You are at the top of the well. Well done. There are etchings on the side of the well. There is a small crack across the floor at the entrance to a room on the east, but it can be crossed easily.

exits.message: It's a long way down!

VAIR1.longDescription: You are about one hundred feet above the bottom of the volcano. The top of the volcano is clearly visible here.

VAIR2.longDescription: You are about two hundred feet above the volcano floor. Looming above is the rim of the volcano. There is a small ledge on the west side.

VAIR3.longDescription: You are high above the floor of the volcano. From here the rim of the volcano looks very narrow and you are very near it. To the east is what appears to be a viewing ledge, too thin to land on.

VAIR4.longDescription: You are near the rim of the volcano which is only about 15 feet across. To the west, there is a place to land on a wide ledge.

VLBOT.longDescription: You are at the bottom of a large dormant volcano. High above you light may be seen entering from the cone of the volcano. The only exit here is to the north.

WCLF1.longDescription: You are on a narrow strip of beach which runs along the base of the White Cliffs. The only path here is a narrow one, heading south along the Cliffs.

exits.message: The path is too narrow.

WCLF2.longDescription: You are on a rocky, narrow strip of beach beside the Cliffs. A narrow path leads north along the shore.

exits.message: The path is too narrow.

WHOUS.longDescription: You are in an open field west of a big white house, with a boarded front door.

exits.message: The door is locked, and there is evidently no key.
